verses.verse: Then came<WH935> David<WH1732> to Nob<WH5011> to Ahimelech<WH288> the priest:<WH3548> and Ahimelech<WH288> was afraid<WH2729> at the meeting<WH7125> of David,<WH1732> and said<WH559> to him, Why<WH4069> are you alone,<WH905> and no<WH369> man<WH376> with you?

Now therefore what<WH4100> is under<WH8478> your hand?<WH3027> give<WH5414> me five<WH2568> loaves of bread<WH3899> in my hand,<WH3027> or<WH176> what there is present.<WH4672>

So the priest<WH3548> gave<WH5414> him hallowed<WH6944> bread: for there was no<WH3808> bread<WH3899> there<WH8033> but the show bread,<WH3899> <WH6440> that was taken<WH5493> from before<WH6440> the LORD,<WH3068> to put<WH7760> hot<WH2527> bread<WH3899> in the day<WH3117> when it was taken<WH3947> away.

Now a certain man<WH376> of the servants<WH5650> of Saul<WH7586> was there that day,<WH3117> detained<WH6113> before<WH6440> the LORD;<WH3068> and his name<WH8034> was Doeg,<WH1673> an Edomite,<WH130> the most chief<WH47> of the herdsmen<WH7462> that belonged to Saul.<WH7586>

And David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Ahimelech,<WH288> And is there not here<WH6311> under<WH8478> your hand<WH3027> spear<WH2595> or<WH176> sword?<WH2719> for I have neither<WH1571> <WH3808> brought<WH3947> my sword<WH2719> nor<WH1571> my weapons<WH3627> with me, because<WH3588> the king's<WH4428> business<WH1697> required<WH1961> haste.<WH5169>

And the priest<WH3548> said,<WH559> The sword<WH2719> of Goliath<WH1555> the Philistine,<WH6430> whom<WH834> you slew<WH5221> in the valley<WH6010> of Elah,<WH425> behold,<WH2009> it is here wrapped<WH3874> in a cloth<WH8071> behind<WH310> the ephod:<WH646> if<WH518> you will take<WH3947> that, take<WH3947> it: for there is no<WH369> other<WH312> save<WH2108> that here.<WH2088> And David<WH1732> said,<WH559> There is none<WH369> like that; give<WH5414> it me.
And David<WH1732> arose <WH6965>and fled<WH1272> that day<WH3117> for fear<WH6440> of Saul,<WH7586> and went<WH935> to Achish<WH397> the king<WH4428> of Gath.<WH1661>

And the servants<WH5650> of Achish<WH397> said<WH559> to him, Is not this<WH2088> David<WH1732> the king<WH4428> of the land?<WH776> did they not sing<WH6030> one to another of him in dances,<WH4246> saying,<WH559> Saul<WH7586> has slain<WH5221> his thousands,<WH505> and David<WH1732> his ten<WH7233> thousands?<WH7233>
And David<WH1732> laid<WH7760> up these<WH428> words<WH1697> in his heart,<WH3824> and was sore<WH3966> afraid<WH3372> of Achish<WH397> the king<WH4428> of Gath.<WH1661>

And he changed<WH8138> his behavior<WH2940> before<WH5869> them, and feigned himself mad<WH1984> in their hands,<WH3027> and scrabbled<WH8427> on<WH5921> the doors<WH1817> of the gate,<WH8179> and let his spittle<WH7388> fall<WH3381> down<WH3381> on his beard.<WH2206>
Then said<WH559> Achish<WH397> to his servants,<WH5650> See,<WH2009> you see<WH7200> the man<WH376> is mad:<WH7696> why<WH4100> then have you brought<WH935> him to me?

Have I need<WH2638> of mad<WH7696> men, that you have brought<WH935> this<WH2088> fellow to play the mad<WH7696> man in my presence?<WH5921> shall this<WH2088> fellow come<WH935> into<WH413> my house?<WH1004>
